title: PGDE Committee Co-Chair
description:
JobID: 11768  

**Position Type:**  

 Committees  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/5/2024  

**Location:**  

 All District  


**General Statement:**  

The Co-Chair of the PGDE Committee, in collaboration with the Coordinator of Talent Acquisition and Development, is responsible for overseeing and monitoring the Stamford Public Schools Professional Growth, Development, and Evaluation (PGDE) Plan for Educators to ensure that it is compliant with the requirements of educator evaluation as established and modified by the Connecticut State Department of Education.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Review Connecticut State Department of Education (CSDE) Educator Evaluation/Professional Development Guidelines.
+ Provide educators feedback concerning the PGDE Plan, including teacher practice, student learning objectives, indicators of academic growth and development, parent feedback, and rating levels, via email, phone, and/or in person meetings.
+ Collaborate with the Coordinator of Talent Acquisition and Development to oversee and monitor the PGDE Plan.
+ Monitor CSDE educator evaluation/professional development requirement updates to ensure the PGDE plan is in compliance with the requirements.
+ Recommend revisions of the PGDE Plan to the Steering Committee and the PGDE Committee on an annual basis as necessary.
+ Co-present modifications to the PGDE Plan to the Board of Education (BOE) that require the BOE’s approval.
+ Present workshops on the PGDE Plan to teachers and administrators.
+ Create PowerPoint presentations and other informational materials used during workshops in collaboration with the Coordinator of Talent Acquisition and Development.
+ Train PGDE committee members to present the PGDE Plan at building-based orientation presentations.
+ Train new teachers on the PGDE Plan process in collaboration with the Coordinator of Talent Acquisition and Development.
+ Review the status of administrator and educator compliance with the PGDE Plan process on a regular basis.
+ Work collaboratively with the Coordinator of Talent Acquisition and Development to provide the Superintendent with reports concerning the status of and compliance with the plan.
+ Convene and lead the PGDE Steering Committee meetings.
+ Convene and lead the PGDE Committee meetings.
+ Facilitate communications between the Steering Committee and the PGDE. Committee in providing feedback and guidance.
+ Prepare for all Steering Committee and PGDE Committee meetings.
+ Respond to correspondence sent to the PGDE Committee email address.
+ Attempt to collaboratively resolve informal disputes concerning the PGDE Plan.
+ Oversee the PGDE Plan's dispute resolution process with the objective of reaching a consensus resolution.
+ Coordinate and oversee dispute resolution hearings.
+ Convene alternate dispute resolution mediation sessions.
+ Collaborate with the Coordinator of Professional Development in designing, implementing, monitoring, and revising the district’s professional development plan.


  

**Qualifications:**
+ Connecticut Educator Certification
+ Current member of the PGDE Committee
+ Knowledge of the PGDE Plan and CT state educator evaluation/professional development guidelines
+ Ability to use and demonstrate the use of the ProTraxx system
+ Ability to maintain confidentiality in all processes
+ Full attendance at all meetings
+ Tenured Teacher-due to overseeing the dispute resolution process
+ Completed four years as a teacher for Stamford Public Schools


  

**Term**  

One (1) Year  

  

**Compensation:**  

Per SEA Contract

title: Produce Lead
description:
ABOUT THE MANAGEMENT COMPANY
  
Creative Culinary Management Company is a hospitality company based in the heart of the Seaport in New York City. The mission of Creative Culinary Management is to channel our passion for creating an elevated culinary experience, all with a view. Each of our restaurants offers a unique experience, whether you are looking for a family feast on the cobblestones, intimate dinner on the pier, or host a private event on our pier rooftop. Our partners' creative energy, combined with our extensive hospitality knowledge, ensures a notable encounter for each of our guests.
  
  

ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY
  
The Tin Building by Jean-Georges is a sprawling food emporium located inside one of New York’s most historic landmarks. The TIN Building features multiple unique venues: Several full-service restaurants, fast casual, and counter dining outlets as well as 10,000 sf of retail featuring private label products, grab and go, grocery and more. To support this significant operation the Marketplace features a large commissary kitchen and bakery, as well as an exhibition kitchen that will provide media opportunities.
  
The Howard Hughes Corporation, the nationally recognized real estate company overseeing the re-development of New York City’s Seaport District, envisions the repositioning of the property as a magnet for attracting locals and visitors alike with a unique, year-round blend of entertainment, food, and retail offerings. The centerpiece of the Seaport District’s renaissance is an entirely re-imagined historic TIN Building, featuring a one-of-a-kind Marketplace and entertainment venue operated by renowned chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten.
  
  

**POSITION SUMMARY:**  

The Produce Lead is responsible for overseeing and managing the Produce Department to ensure optimal product freshness, presentation, and inventory levels. This role requires a deep understanding of produce, strong organizational skills, and a commitment to delivering exceptional customer service. The Produce Lead will report directly to the AGM of Fresh and collaborate closely with the team to achieve department goals.
  
  

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES
  
* Oversee daily operations of the Produce Department, including staffing, ordering, merchandising, and inventory management.
* Maintain a visually appealing and well-organized produce display, prioritizing local and seasonal products.
* Adhere to strict food safety and sanitation standards, as well as Department of Weights and Measures regulations.
* Implement and execute effective inventory control strategies, including accurate ordering, product rotation, and waste minimization.
* Provide excellent customer service by offering product knowledge and addressing customer inquiries.
* Train and develop team members to ensure department standards are met.
* Collaborate with the AGM of Fresh on department goals, performance metrics, and operational improvements.
* Actively clean daily and weekly fridges and display areas to maintain an environment as clean as possible. Be proactive in contacting the AGM in case of malfunctioning appliances.
* Make sure all signs are always present on the display when the store is open and are updated with prices matching the point of sales system
* Consistently report to scheduled shifts on time and ready to work in proper uniform.
* Operate ethically to protect the assets and image of the company.
* Receive orders and ensure proper receiving by other staff in accordance with established procedures. Communicate with the AGM to ensure accurate receiving records are kept.
* Perform all other tasks or duties as assigned and/or per business need.


**KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS:**  

* Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in the produce industry.
* Previous supervisory experience preferred.
* In-depth knowledge of fruits, vegetables, and seasonal produce trends.
* Strong organizational and time management skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Proficiency in inventory management systems (if applicable).


**PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:**  

* Ability to perform the essential job functions consistent safely and successfully with the ADA, FMLA and other federal, state, and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.
* Ability to lift over 50 pounds
* Ability to stand for prolong periods of time and climb steps regularly.
* Ability to physically maneuver through work areas; bend, lift, carry, reach/extend arms, push/pull, and lift hands above shoulder height frequently, or otherwise move in a constantly changing environment.


The base pay range for this position is between $22.00 - $25.00 per hour. The determination of what a specific employee in this job classification is paid depends on a number of factors, including, but not limited to, prior employment history/job-related knowledge, qualifications and skills, etc.
  
  

Creative Culinary Management is an equal opportunity employer.
  
  

NOTICE TO THIRD PARTY AGENCIES
  
Please note that CCMC does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Fee Agreement along with explicit communication to open the search, CCMC will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, CCMC reserves the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of CCMC.

title: Hart Magnet Elementary School: Elementary Teacher – Grade 3
description:
JobID: 11769  

**Position Type:**  

 Elementary School Teaching  

**Date Posted:**  

 8/5/2024  

**Location:**  

 Stamford, CT  

**Date Available:**  

 2024-2025 School Year **The filling of this position is based upon continued funding in the Board of Education budget.**  

  

**Note: Teachers dually certified in TESOL, Bilingual Education or ESL, with experience in Sheltered Instruction or fluency in a language other than English, will be given preference for all Stamford Public School positions.**  

  

  

**Job Description** – Elementary Teacher  

  

**General Statement:**  

A competent **Elementary Teacher** understands growth and development, demonstrates knowledge of what is to be taught and facility in the basic skills and helps students to develop positive self-concepts. The **Elementary Teacher** stimulates the independence of each student as a learner, effectively assesses student needs and progress, and plans instruction to achieve selected objectives, including those appropriate for exceptional students. The **Elementary Teacher** accomplishes these objectives through effective communication with students, parents and colleagues, and through the use of appropriate techniques and materials in a positive climate where time, space and equipment are effectively organized for instruction. In addition, the **Elementary Teacher** meets professional responsibility for continuing growth and fosters cooperative involvement with parents and the community.  

  

**Major Responsibilities:**
+ Demonstrates facility in the skills of reading, writing and mathematics.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the subject to be taught.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of human growth and development as it relates to the teaching-learning process.
+ Demonstrates knowledge of the American public school system.
+ Plans instruction to achieve selected objectives.
+ Effectively implements instructional plans and uses appropriate instructional techniques.
+ Effectively communicates with students.
+ Helps students develop positive self-concepts.
+ Facilitates the independence of the student as learner.
+ Effectively organizes time, space, materials and equipment for instruction.
+ Effectively assesses student needs and progress.
+ Effectively meets the needs of exceptional students.
+ Establishes a positive learning environment.
+ Meets professional responsibilities.
+ Encourages and maintains the cooperative involvement and support of parents and the community.

**Qualifications:**
+ A valid Connecticut teacher certificate in 013-Elementary, K-6; 305-Elementary, 1–6.
+ Demonstrated excellence in teaching the subject area(s) and/or instructional levels targeted.
+ Evidence of ability to work cooperatively with administrators, teachers and educational assistants.
+ Evidence of organizational ability and willingness to pursue tasks to successful completion.
+ Superior communication skills (oral and written).
+ Knowledge of and/or demonstrate the ability to learn and implement Operating Systems (i.e. Windows); Office suites (i.e. Microsoft Office, Google Docs); Presentation Software (i.e. PowerPoint, Keynote); Spreadsheets (i.e. Excel, Google Spreadsheets); Communication and Collaboration tools (i.e. Skype); Accounting Software (i.e. QuickBooks); Student Information Systems (i.e. Naviance, Power School); or any other technology deemed relevant for this position.


  

Sept. 1991  

  

**Union:**  

Stamford Education Association (SEA)  

  

**Salary****:** $50,684 to $123,992  

Step Placement is based on education and experience as outlined in Article 4 (D) of the SEA Contract.  

  

**Application Procedures:**  

Online application is required.  

  

**Internal Applicants** - Please upload:
+ A cover letter summarizing your interest in and qualifications for this position


+ A resume


+ A minimum of 2 letters of reference, at least one of which is from a current supervisor



  

**External Applicants** - Please upload a minimum of 2 letters of reference, at least one of which is from a current or recent past supervisor.  

  

Letters of reference should be dated within the last two years.

title: Seafood Warehouse Worker
description:
About The Chefs' Warehouse
  
The Chefs' Warehouse, Inc. (http://www.chefswarehouse.com) combines exceptional quality and brand building with broadline food service distribution for more than 35 years. With Protein, Specialty, Produce, and Broadline offerings, we service the most discerning chefs in a hybrid approach of convenience and superior quality. We introduce more than 2,000 artisan producers of the world’s finest ingredients from over 40 countries to the finest chefs in the world. We passionately consult, sell, and build relationships with more than 35,000 customers through the most experienced network of over 600 consultive sales associates, best-in-breed technology, rapid service, and support levels that solidify our long-standing ties to both established and up-and-coming premium restaurants.
  
  

**Mission:** The mission of The Chefs’ Warehouse is to provide the world’s greatest ingredients to the world’s best chefs.
  
  

**Our C.H.E.F.S. Values:**  

Curious & Creative
  
Hungry For Food & Results
  
Entrepreneurial
  
Forward Thinking & Flexible
  
Supportive (Of Peers & Chefs)
  
  

**Pay range:** $18-$20/HR
  
**Position Summary:** Assists manager by ensuring inventory properly recorded and rotated into stock. Processes fresh fish for customer orders. Selects products from pick ticket and stages orders. Replenish stock as needed.
  
  

**What you’ll do:**  

* Ensure all incoming seafood is properly rotated into stock
* Ensure that production maintains a steady flow in order to meet production requirements
* Reads production schedule or customer order to determine items to be processed, moved, gathered, or distributed.
* Conveys materials and items from stocked locations to production areas or storage or to other designated areas using electric pallet jack.
* Lift seafood onto table- Lifting 15-20#s consistently, frequently up to 50# and occasionally up to 100# with assistance.
* Uses electric scaling machine to scale fish- involves standing for long periods.
* Sorts and places items on racks, shelves, or in bins according to predetermined sequence such as size, type, style, color, or product code.
* Work in refrigerated rooms 30-36 degrees.
* Fills requisitions, work orders, or requests for stock items and distributes items.
* Assembles customer orders from stock and places orders on pallets or shelves, or conveys orders to packing station or shipping department to prepare for shipping.
* Marks or labels items with identifying information.
* Opens boxes, crates, and other containers.
* Records amounts of items distributed.
* Weighs or counts items for distribution within plant to ensure conformance to company standards
* Compiles worksheets or tickets from customer specifications.
* Maintain cleanliness of work area including warehouse.


**About you:**  

* High school diploma or general education degree (GED)
* Two to three years related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.


The above job description is not an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties as assigned by their supervisor.
  
  

**Perks & Benefits:**  

* Paid Vacations, Paid Holidays
* Health, Dental and Medical Benefits
* Weekly pay
* Life Insurance
* 5% above cost for our high-quality food products
* Employee discounts for travel and events
* 401k


The Chefs' Warehouse is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate based on actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Our management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities and general treatment during employment. We are dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce.

title: Coordinating Manager - L B
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Harlem Hospital Center has been a bedrock of the Harlem community since 1887. The hospital provides a wide range of medical, surgical, diagnostic, therapeutic and family support services to the residents of Central Harlem, West Harlem, Washington Heights and Inwood. Harlem is the largest hospital in the area, capable of treating the most seriously ill. Harlem provides over 90 specialized ambulatory care services, dentistry and oral surgery, behavioral health services, and community substance abuse treatment.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.




**Job Description**
-------------------

  


 Consults with medical and professional staff of other departments and staff from associated health care fields to plan and coordinate joint patient and management objectives. Acts as a liaison between the Department of Medical Services and other administrative divisions.


Provides administrative supervision for a program of comprehensive health service of professional and non-professional staff involving therapists, counselors and related health personnel.


Plans, develops, and may conduct training programs to maintain proficiency of staff and use of new equipment and methods.


Allocates staff on basis of workload, space, and available equipment.


Participates in budgetary planning, reviews operating costs, performs cost studies and prepares department budgets.


May supervise studies related to the service/program and analyzes modifications and development of systems and procedures to improve departmental operations. Makes recommendations and implements.


Coordinates research projects and conducts special studies to evaluate various rehabilitative programs in the department and within the overall objective of the department.


Directs the processing of medically prescribed orders for requisitioning of equipment, prosthetic appliances, and medical supplies for patients.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Public Administration, Business Administration, Social Work, Psychology or Rehabilitation Counseling; and


2. Two (2) years of full-time experience in medically-oriented health care and medical support systems environment, one (1) year of which included experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in such occupations as physical, occupational, inhalation, speech and audiology therapy or as Medical/Laboratory Technologist, Microbiologist (various specialties), Chemist (biochemist), Radiation and X-Ray Technician; or two (2) years of responsible level experience in business management systems or general administration including one (1) year in a supervisory or administrative capacity; or


3. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in disciplines listed in “1” above; and


4. Three (3) years of full-time experience, as described in “2” above, including two (2) years of experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in occupations, as listed in “2” above; or


5. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button.


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Community Living Coordinator

description:
**Harlem Congregations for Community Improvement, Inc.** is looking for a star **Tenant Coordinator** on-site to deliver services to promote housing stability in our Senior Affordable Rental Apartments (SARA) Program.

Our **Coordinators** support Independent Community Living buildings. Some of the service responsibilities include:

* Engage formerly homeless seniors including but not limited to welcome and assessment meetings.
* Caseload management of approximately 1-20 tenants.
* Conduct home visits at least once (1) per month, and as needed, to review support plan goals, assess new needs, and encourage participation in supportive and community services and activities.
* Escort to services or skill-building activities, based on tenant needs.
* All assessments, support plans, contacts, and programming will be documented in tenant and program files.
* Reporting effective case management notes

* As appropriate, educate tenants on service availability, application and benefits procedures, tenant rights, and advocacy.

* Providing information and training to tenants regarding the obligations of tenancy.
* Ensuring tenants maintain housing subsidies and other benefits required to remain in permanent housing.
* Community-based social services including senior centers, case management programs, food pantries, etc.

title: Revenue Operations Manager - Partners & Services
description:
We are looking for a Revenue Operations Manager to join our revenue operations team.
You will work closely with our Partners and Services leadership and global Revenue Operations team, and drive growth and efficiency within the team. This is an instrumental role for our revenue department, with significant responsibility and impact on the business and its results.**About The Role**
------------------

* Collaborate with partners/services leadership to identify trends and business opportunities within the departments
* Define and provide visibility on main KPIs and business metrics for each group, and build and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor the business performance
* Act as the primary point of contact for the partners and services leadership teams, working cross functionally with the global department leaders, marketing, sales, customer success, enablement and more
* Support or run key meetings for both internal and external audiences, providing valuable business insights and keeping everyone aligned
**Your Experience & Skills**
----------------------------

* 4+ years of experience in revenue or business operations roles (B2B SaaS preferred)
* Experience working with partnerships or services departments is an advantage
* Comfortable working with Salesforce, (including manipulating large data sets), Google Sheets, and BI tools (Looker/Tableau, SQL - an advantage)
* Experience presenting data to management, and translating complex data and trends into clear actionable insights
* Curious, proactive, ambitious, loves solving complex problems and excited to help others and share the success
* Strong collaboration and communication skills - this is key to success in this role

**What monday.com can offer you:*** Opportunity to join a well-funded, proven company with big ambitions, competitive salary and benefit package, bonus potential, and eligibility to take part in the company equity incentive program
* Amazing company culture that values transparency and collaboration while never forgetting to have fun while we work!
* Monthly stipends for food, wellness, and commuter work
* Fully dedicated learning and development team that provides opportunities for our employees to hone and gain new skills
* Award winning work environment - named a "Best Place to Work" by BuiltIn as well as "Great Place To Work" certified
* We foster diversity, inclusion, and belonging through our Employee Resource Groups in addition to providing access to resources and education to support our team, facilitate conversations, and encourage understanding
* A global work environment with employees in Tel Aviv, New York, San Francisco, Miami, Chicago, Denver, London, Kiev, Sydney, São Paulo, and Tokyo


For New York City-based hires only: Compensation Range: $130,000-$150,000 base salary, subject to standard withholding and applicable taxes. In addition to base salary, the role includes opportunity to receive and/or earn a discretionary bonus and/or equity based on Company’s plans and in accordance with Company’s policies. Compensation finally awarded to the candidate will be commensurate with the candidate’s skills and experience. Compensation ranges for candidates in locations outside of New York City may differ based on the cost of labor and such additional factors for such other locations.
Visa sponsorship for this role is currently not available.
monday.com is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We hire talented individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, ancestry, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, military or veteran status, cultural background, religious beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.

title: Registered Dietitian - Diabetes Educator/ Fair Lawn
description:
**Summary of Position:**

The clinical dietitian will work closely with the Director of the Weight Management Program to develop an evidence-based, comprehensive and multi-disciplinary Weight Management Program with the goals of improving health outcomes, quality indicators and patient experience. The clinical dietitian will be comfortable providing one-on-one nutrition counseling and leading support groups. Experience in weight management is not a requirement for this position as long as the clinical dietitian is willing and can learn evidence-based weight management. Our approach to weight management is multi-disciplinary therefore the clinical dietitian should be able to collaborate effectively with obesity medicine specialists, bariatric surgeons, behavioral health providers, exercise trainers, endocrinologists, primary care physicians, RN Care Managers and other interdisciplinary team members.

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Obtain a complete nutrition history and nutrition-related physical examination.
* Formulate and implement a nutrition therapy plan based on the assessment of nutritional needs and medical condition.
* Demonstrates knowledge of nutrition therapy for common disease states such as hypertension, diabetes, and celiac disease.
* Adapt nutrition therapy and counseling to specific socioeconomic status and cultural needs of the patient to enhance compliance.
* Proficient with use of EHR including visit documentation, coding and billing relevant to scope of service.
* Communicate and document change in patient's condition to all appropriate providers.
* Assist in developing nutrition, physical activity and behavior curriculum for the weight management program support groups.
* Assist with data collection for tracking and analysis of outcomes for process improvement purposes.
* Contribute to patient recruitment and marketing efforts.
* Participate in community outreach efforts.
* Participate in Weight Management Program development team meetings.
* Strong advocate of patients with obesity.
* Demonstrates excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Performs administrative tasks as needed, but not limited to: Helping patients order products. Discuss program option and support group services with patients. Monitor and order meal replacement products for the clinic.
* Additional job functions may include:Assist in developing and implementing a screening program to identify patients at-risk for malnutrition, manage and provide appropriate enteral and parenteral nutrition recommendation, and create an individualized nutrition care plan for patients with malnutrition.

Diabetes counseling and education to patients and families including blood glucose monitoring, medication administration, nutrition plans; and foot, eye, review of glucose logs, and answering questions about glucose meter, CGM or insulin pumps. Certified Diabetes Educator is preferred but not required.

**General Job functions:**

* Other job duties as required
* Maintains knowledge of current advances in field of nutrition and weight management and completes at least 75 CE credits every 5 years.
* Maintain NJ State License.
* Maintain professional memberships.
* Works collaboratively and effectively with all SMG departments and services.
* Works in a professional, courteous and effective manner.
* Participates in community as nutrition advocate and educator.
* Serves as a resource and consultant for physicians and nursing staff for special nutrition needs.
* Promotes team atmosphere among colleagues and staff. Works effectively with staff.
* Performs as a preceptor when and if necessary for new hires into the department.
* Acts as a patient advocate and upholds patient's rights. Refers ethical concerns to appropriate resources.
* Must be able to travel between patient care locations.

**Physical Job Requirements:**

* Physical mobility, which includes movement from place to place on the job, taking distance and speed into account.
* Physical agility, which includes ability to maneuver body while in place.
* Endurance (e.g. continuous typing, prolonged standing/bending, walking).
* Balance is maintained during climbing, bending and/or reaching.
* Dexterity of hands and fingers.

**Environmental Risks**

* Chemicals, Chemotherapy and Fumes
* Magnetic fields
* Radiation
* Sharps
* Latex
* Combative Patients / Visitors

**Blood-borne Pathogens:**

* Exposure to infectious hazards, blood, body fluids, non-intact skin or tissue specimens.
* Contact with patients or patient specimens are possible.

**Education, Certification, Computer and Training Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Nutrition, Dietetics or related field
* Registered Dietitian with current CDR
* Licensed dietitian in NJ
* Master's degree in Nutrition preferred
* Ability to communicate in English, both orally and in writing required.
* Strong interpersonal and organization skills required.
* Strong ability to perform diverse work assignments and make decisions with minimal supervision under time limitations
* Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills required.
* Strong multi-tasking and priority setting skills required.
* Experience with Standard Office Equipment (Phone, Fax, Copy Machine, Scanner, and Email/Voice Mail) required.
* Experience with Standard Office Technology in a Window based environment preferred.
* Proficient with MS Word, Excel, and Power Point.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Dietetics

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Diabetes Education: 2 years (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Registered Dietitian (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Optometrist (bilingual in English and Chinese)
description:
**Description:**  
Four Season Medical PLLC is seeking an Optometrist to add to our practice! The ideal candidate is a Physician with post-fellowship experience, but we are also open to Physicians who have recently finished their fellowship. We are looking for an optometrist to see internally referred patients at our Brooklyn location. We have a busy practice with 15 PCPs in total and we expect the optometry practice to build quickly. This is a great opportunity for a Physician with a strong sense of best practices and with leadership capability! Full administrative support for billing, credentialing, and scheduling will be provided by our company. We are looking for a Specialist who will set the tone for the practice. Candidates are required to be fluent in Chinese(Mandarin, Cantonese, Fujianese, or other Chinese dialects).

**Job Duties:**  
- Work 3 to 5 days per week  
- 9:30 AM – 5:30 PM  
- See 20-35 patients per day  
- Maintain patient records.  
- Prescribe medications to treat ocular diseases and disorders.  
- Perform pre- and post-operation checks.  
- Check patients for signs of diseases and refer them to other specialists when needed.  
-Conduct routine eye exams for clients.

**Qualifications:**  
- Licensed in New York State Board Certified or Eligible

- 1+ year of experience preferred but not required

- Active New York State license

- Bilingual in English and Chinese(Mandarin, Cantonese, Fujianese and other Chinese dialect)

**Benefits:**  
- Negotiable salary: We know the job market is competitive and we will work with the right Physician to make compensation the most ideal for you.  
- 3 week’s vacation (full-time) or 2 week’s vacation (part-time)  
- 40 hours sick-time (full-time)  
- 6 paid holidays  
- Health insurance for individuals (full-time)  
- Visa and Green Card Sponsorship We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $160,000.00 - $200,000.00 per year

Expected hours: 24 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off

Medical Specialty:

* Primary Care

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Language:

* bilingually in English and Chinese (Required)

License/Certification:

* NYS Optometry License (Required)
* BC/BE (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11220 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY 11220: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Coordinating Manager-Level B
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**
--------------------------------

  


Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center is one of New York City’s premier acute care hospitals. Located in Downtown Bronx, Lincoln is a teaching hospital renowned for its Centers of Excellence, and a recognized industry leader in the implementation of state-of-the art medical technology and best practices. Our team of highly trained and caring medical professionals is dedicated to providing the highest quality health care that is safe, compassionate, culturally competent and patient-centered. Comprehensive services are offered in three major primary care areas: Medicine, Pediatrics, and Women’s Health in addition to more than eighty (80) specialty services. At Lincoln, the safety and comfort of our patients is our number one priority.


At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.


Visit us at www.nyc.gov/html/hhc/lincoln.


**Job Description**
-------------------

  


**PURPOSE OF POSITION:**


Under general supervision with moderate latitude for independent initiative and judgment, manages the operations of the departmental and provides confidential support to the Chief Quality Officer. This position directly reports to the Chief Quality Officer.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Secretarial support for the Chief Quality Officer.
* Acts as a liaison between the Office of Quality and other medical and administrative departments.


-Preparation and coordination of the monthly Hospital-Wide Quality Assurance & Performance -Improvement (HWQAPI) report; including drafting of committee minutes.

* Maintains a calendar of standing meetings with the various departments for their PIs.
* Facilitator for PI capacity-building programs including Quality Academy and HASP
* Facilitates triage and timely completion and submission of responses to Quality of Care concerns from Managed care Organizations
* Maintains correspondence, schedules, memoranda, and other documents for the department.
* May represent the departmental administrator in external contracts with community organizations and agencies as required.
* Performs other related duties as assigned by the CQO and Director of Quality Management / Regulatory Affairs.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------

  


1. A Master’s degree from an accredited college or university in Public Health, Public Administration, Business Administration, Social Work, Psychology or Rehabilitation Counseling; and  

2. Two (2) years of full-time experience in medically-oriented health care and medical support systems environment, one (1) year of which included experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in such occupations as physical, occupational, inhalation, speech and audiology therapy or as Medical/Laboratory Technologist, Microbiologist (various specialties), Chemist (biochemist), Radiation and X-Ray Technician; or two (2) years of responsible level experience in business management systems or general administration including one (1) year in a supervisory or administrative capacity; or  

3. A Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university in disciplines listed in “1” above; and  

4. Three (3) years of full-time experience, as described in “2” above, including two (2) years of experience in an administrative or supervisory capacity in occupations, as listed in “2” above; or  

5. A satisfactory equivalent combination of education, training and/or experience.  

  

Note: Certification or licensure may be required.


**How To Apply**
----------------

  


If you wish to apply for this position, please apply online by clicking the "Apply Now" button or forward your resume, noting the above Job ID #, to:  

  

Lincoln Medical & Mental Health Center  

Human Resources Department  

234 Eugenio Maria De Hostos Blvd, (East 149th Street),  

2nd Floor, Annex  

Bronx, NY 10451  

Attn: Recruitment Unit


NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Community Manager, Higher Education
description:
**About the Team**


The Community team at OpenAI is dedicated to building relationships with early adopters—individuals who are pioneering and shaping compelling use cases for our technologies. We showcase these early adopters’ use cases and insights for their broader communities to learn from. We focus on four distinct cohorts: visual creatives (film, animation, illustration), writers, educators, and internet creators.

**About the Role**


As our first Community Manager for Higher Education, you will focus on architecting how OpenAI builds relationships with and empowers educators—to start, professors, associate professors, and other academic professionals—who are early adopters of AI tools in their classrooms. Your mission is to find the important members of this community, learn from their AI applications, and help amplify their stories and use cases so millions more educators can learn from them.


OpenAI is a very special company. We’re governed by a nonprofit, and people come to work here because they think developing and deploying AI safely is the most important work to be done in our lifetime. Community Managers are a part of a team that is focused on building relationships with creatives and educators whose work will be transformed by this technology, and doing all that we can to empower them.


The purpose of community building is different here. We’re not focused on followers or ROI. Conversations about our technology are dictated by the first people, often individuals, to share use cases and impressions. We’re focused on finding the people who are developing pioneering applications of AI and then showcasing their insights to the larger community.
  

We’re looking for someone who can build sincere and trusting relationships with these special educators, while also realizing a variety of well-executed projects (stories, events, test groups) in service of them.


This role is based in New York, NY or San Francisco, CA. We offer relocation assistance to new employees.

**In this role, you will:**

* Own and manage building a community of early and important adopters in higher education. This will include understanding that community, finding exceptional community members, doing outreach with them, and highlighting their insights for using our products.
* Draft blog posts, social posts, and more about members of this cohort. On occasion, collaborate with our internal video and events team to produce ambitious moments.
* Translate complicated technological advances to different audiences with a variety of technical backgrounds, ranging from someone who has just discovered ChatGPT to audiences of Computer Science professors who are experts.
* Develop and manage an early access community—a special set of early adopters in education who we trust to try our technologies first and shape applications for others.
* Collaborate cross-functionally to drive, build and maintain systems that allow OpenAI teams to learn from this community’s use cases and insights.

**You might thrive in this role if you:**

* Have experience in scaled community building, preferably in a scrappy startup environment.
* Enjoy hunting for interesting outliers online. Have the ability to quickly build warm, trusting relationships with new people over email, zoom, and beyond.
* Have **exceptional** verbal and written communication skills. Can turn your educator use cases into clear and engaging stories.
* Are confident creating briefs for seasoned creative partners, such as video and events specialists, and helping them realize work that honors members of a community.
* Are curious about new developments in AI and how they are transforming education.
* Thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working across teams and departments with colleagues from different backgrounds and areas of expertise.
* Are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and can adapt to changing priorities and technologies. You are resourceful and can find creative solutions to challenges.
* Believe in the importance of transparency and authenticity in communication.

**About OpenAI**


OpenAI is an AI research and deployment company dedicated to ensuring that general-purpose artificial intelligence benefits all of humanity. We push the boundaries of the capabilities of AI systems and seek to safely deploy them to the world through our products. AI is an extremely powerful tool that must be created with safety and human needs at its core, and to achieve our mission, we must encompass and value the many different perspectives, voices, and experiences that form the full spectrum of humanity.


We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status.


For US Based Candidates: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.


We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities, and requests can be made via this link.


OpenAI Global Applicant Privacy Policy


At OpenAI, we believe artificial intelligence has the potential to help people solve immense global challenges, and we want the upside of AI to be widely shared. Join us in shaping the future of technology.

----------------

title: Solutions Architect, Enterprise
description:
**About the Team**


The Success team is responsible for ensuring developers and enterprises are successful in building scalable production applications with the OpenAI API platform. We guide and support customers to achieve maximum benefits, value, and adoption from deploying our highly-capable models. OpenAI's customers represent a range of diverse backgrounds and maturity, from early-stage startups to established global enterprises.

**About the Role**


We are looking for a technically savvy and business-minded solutions architect to deeply partner with our most strategic and high-impact platform customers, guiding them through application ideation, development, delivery, and scale to accelerate and maximize the value of what they build with our platform. You will have the opportunity to work on the most novel and creative use cases being built on our API, serving as a critical partner for collecting and delivering high fidelity feedback to Product and Research teams. You will collaborate closely with the Account Engineering, Partnerships Research, and Product teams, and will report to the Head of Success.

**In this role, you will:**

* Deeply embed with our most strategic platform customers, serving as their technical thought partner in ideating and building novel applications on our API.
* Proactively provide guidance to our customers on how to maximize business impact from their applications, accelerating their time to value.
* Experiment and prototype solutions with and for your customers.
* Forge and manage relationships with our customers’ leadership and stakeholders to ensure their application’s successful deployment and scale.
* Contribute to our open-source developer and enterprise resources.
* Scale the Solutions Architect function through sharing knowledge, codifying best practices, and publishing notebooks to our internal and external repositories.
* Validate, synthesize, and deliver high-signal feedback to the Product and Research teams.
* Use your expertise in programming with Python and Javascript.

**You’ll thrive in this role if you:**

* Have 3+ years of technical consulting (or equivalent) experience.
* Are proficient in Python and Javascript.
* Built and/or delivered prototypes on top of our API platform.
* Led complex technical projects and programs with many stakeholders.
* Can proactively identify opportunities for maximizing our customers’ business value through leveraging the OpenAI API.
* Own problems end-to-end, and are willing to pick up whatever knowledge you're missing to get the job done to ensure both your team and our customers succeed.
* Have a humble attitude and an eagerness to help others with empathy.
* Operate with high horsepower, are adept at frequent context switching and working on multiple projects at once with expansive ownership, and ruthlessly prioritize.
* Thrive in dynamic environments and can navigate ambiguity with ease.

title: IT Support
description:

As part of the IT team, you will work in a secure, employee-focused, and highly technical environment. We work hard to make sure our diverse team of researchers, engineers, and operations/people specialists have the tools they need to work comfortably, securely, and with minimal interruptions. We work closely with our friendly and accomplished Security team to secure and update our endpoints and corporate infrastructure. title: Front Desk Associate (Morning/Afternoon Shift) - West Islip
description:
**Job Overview:**



At Blink, this role is called a Moodlifter, but until that is a word job seekers are typing into Google, we will stick with using the more widely known title of Front Desk Associate! What is a Moodlifter you ask? Moodlifters are the people who greet each of our members with ear to ear smiles, over the top enthusiasm and pretty much know everyone in the gym by name. They will run to open the door for you in a driving rainstorm and change a channel so you don’t miss a minute of the big game. They consistently go above and beyond and you can’t help but smile when you see them.


**Responsibilities:**


* Greet every member and guest with enthusiasm and a smile
* Tour potential members around the club with the goal of signing up the person for a membership
* Answer phone calls in a professional and energetic manner
* Execute all opening/closing operational procedures to ensure the club runs smoothly
* Handle member requests and concerns with a sense of urgency
* Actively participate in ensuring the club is spotless including frequent bending, lifting, and walking around the club to organize equipment and straighten up
* Sign members up for startup sessions with Blink Personal Trainers
* Maintain regular and punctual attendance
* Comply with all company policies and procedures


**Qualifications:**


* Enthusiastic, energetic, friendly and personable
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Able to lift and move gym equipment weighing 15-20 lbs frequently and 45 lbs occasionally
* Able to remain in a stationary position at the front desk for the majority of the workday
* World class customer service skills
* Works hard, multi-tasks and is a problem solver
* Passion for the Blink brand


**Compensation and Benefits:**


* **Pay Transparency: $16.00/hr**
* Complimentary Blink Membership
* Benefits


**Company Overview:**



Founded in 2011 by executives at Equinox, Blink Fitness is a premium quality, value-based fitness brand with more than 100 locations open or in development throughout New York, New Jersey, Pennsylvania and California. Blink puts Mood Above Muscle™, which celebrates the positive feeling you get from exercise, not just the physical benefits.



Blink is an exciting and dynamic business that is still in the start-up mode. We are a passionate team with a great entrepreneurial spirit and a willingness to roll up our sleeves to get the work done.



For more information visit Blink’s consumer website - blinkfitness.com – and its franchise website –blinkfranchising.com
company_addresses: 386 Park Avenue South, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10016
company_description: At Blink, we’re a fitness family on a mission to bring all the benefits of exercise to as many people as possible. It’s like we always say:

title: Facilities Manager - Temporary (Until Nov 30, 2024)
description:
**Owned and operated by Elysabeth Kleinhans Theatrical Foundation—a not-for-profit operating foundation—59E59 Theaters is a lively venue with a 195-seat theater, a 99-seat theater and a 40-60 seat flexible theater. We present a year-round curated program of about 34 Off-Broadway productions that are nurtured and supported through highly subsidized rental rates that include: technical, ticketing, FOH, marketing & advertising, facilities, and press services.**

**59E59 Theaters is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. BIPOC applicants and candidates from populations underrepresented in the theater field are strongly encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, familial status, sexual orientation, national origin, ability, age, or veteran status.**

**59E59 Theaters Staff Agreement**

**CURRENT JOB OPENINGS**
------------------------

**Facilities Manager - Temporary (Until Nov 30, 2024)**
-------------------------------------------------------


59E59 Theaters seeks a qualified candidate for the role of **Facilities Manager**.


The Facilities Manager is responsible for the upkeep of our physical plant and overall cleanliness of our four-story, 15,000 square foot building. In alignment with our Community Agreement, the Facilities Manager will uphold 59E59’s mission, our dedication to inclusion, diversity, equity and accessibility (IDEA) in the workplace, and our commitment to be an anti-racist organization.

**Reports to:** Managing Director

**Hours:** Daytime, 5 days a week- may include Saturday and/or Sunday

**Manages:** 2 FT staff

**NOTE: THIS IS A TEMPORARY POSITION AND WILL BEGIN ON HIRING THROUGH NOVEMBER 30, 2024.**

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Supervision of Fire Alarms and Sprinkler Systems
* Knowledge of basic plumbing, electrical, carpentry, and painting a plus
* Supervise and participate in cleaning of offices, theaters, bathrooms and public areas
* Hiring contractors to undertake building maintenance projects
* Coordinate building maintenance contractors for elevator, fire systems, HVAC, etc.
* Build and maintain relationships with peer organizations and external vendors
* Lead by example, motivate and empower your team to excel
* Establish collaborative relationships with other departments
* Participate in Annual 360 Review Process
* Additional duties as assigned by Managing Director

**Qualifications:**

* Must acquire FDNY Certificates of Fitness S95 Supervision of Fire Alarms and S12 Supervision of Sprinkler Systems
* Experience managing others a plus
* Able to work independently and communicate clearly

**Salary:** $1,094 per week


59E59 Theaters offers a range of benefits including medical, dental, sick leave, Transitchecks, flexible spending accounts, paid educational and professional development opportunities.


To apply, please send a resume and cover letter to Brian Beirne, Managing Director at jobs@59e59.org.


Please include **FACILITIES MANAGER** in the subject line. In the cover letter, please include why this position at 59E59 interests you and how your previous experience enables you to be successful in this role.


Referrals of qualified candidates are also welcome.


59E59 Theaters is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. BIPOC applicants and candidates from populations underrepresented in the theater field are strongly encouraged to apply. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, familial status, sexual orientation, National origin, ability, age, or veteran status.

title: Full Time Visual Associate - MUJI Fifth Avenue
description:
**About MUJI:**

MUJI is a global retailer of high-quality, simple products across various categories – from homewares to fashion to wellness and more – that provide satisfying, expertly-designed solutions for everyday needs. MUJI’s full name, Mujirushi Ryohin, loosely translates to “No-Brand, Quality Goods”, underscoring its enduring commitment to modesty, affordability, and quality.

Established in Japan in 1980, MUJI has steadily grown as the go-to brand for millions of loyal customers in 37 countries and regions around the world offering over 7,000 products. While varying significantly in purpose and use, MUJI products are marked by the quality, craftsmanship, knowledge, expertise, and skill that is embodied in being able to get something very simple, very right.

MUJI continually strives to embody business practices that demonstrate a commitment to our communities and environment. We seek for our future MUJI team members to be aligned with this very same brand ethos to create a positive impact in all of our communities, neighborhoods, and networks.

Currently, MUJI U.S.A. is actively seeking a Full Time Visual Associate to join our MUJI Fifth Avenue location. This is a multi-faceted role where you will have the opportunity to be involved in a variety of functions. If your experience/education and/or skill set match our needs, we want to hear from you!

**Purpose**

As the Full Time Visual Associate, your expertise lies in executing effective floor sets, visual merchandising updates, in-store signage, windows, upper displays. You ensure the store is always at MUJI standard through coaching and development of the team. You have an eye for details, you are passionate about visual standards and merchandising, and you love working with your team. Most importantly, you represent the MUJI values and bring your A-game every day.

**Role and Responsibilities:**

* Support driving an outstanding customer experience in partnership with the management team by ensuring your store is always representative of the MUJI standards
* Deliver monthly floor set execution and weekly visual merchandising updates by training and coaching the sales team
* Ensure all areas of the store are effectively executed to MUJI standards - including windows, upper displays and merchandising all departments
* Ensure assigned store remains at a high standard at all times. You follow up on the day-to-day merchandising, sell-through adjustments and replenishment
* A detailed eye for merchandising opportunities. Ready to game plan with the store managers and take action to drive results
* MUJI values are a priority
* Ensure store safety standards are maintained on the salesfloor and in the stockroom
* Support overall store operations, including operating POS, attending fitting rooms, stock management, etc. Ensuring these operational areas are always customer ready and at the highest standard

**Qualifications**

* A MUJI brand ambassador with passion for our products and philosophy
* At least one year of visual experience
* Ability to multi-task and have attention to detail
* Prioritize and understand the importance of time management
* Flexible availability - mornings, evenings and weekends
* A passion for details and seeing things others don’t
* Love working in the stores. Love working with people. Love your customers.

This job description is designed to help communicate the role. This is not an exhaustive list, as you may be required to take on additional tasks as directed by your manager.

Please attach resume when applying.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.33 - $23.39 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10017: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
company_description: Mujirushi Ryohin, MUJI in Japanese, translates as "no-brand quality goods". MUJI U.S.A. LIMITED is a subsidiary of Ryohin Keikaku Co., Ltd. which is MUJI's corporate entity incorporated in Japan.

title: Nurse Practitioner/Allied Health Professional
description:
**Job Summary:**


The Hospitalist Medicine Advanced Practice Provider (Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant) will deliver primary health care in the hospital setting to include, but not limited to, the recognition and management of common illnesses and injuries; and the provisioning of care across the health care continuum with emphasis on early detection, treatment, and prevention of diseases.


**Essential Functions:**


* Obtains and records patient history
* Consults with physician as established in the collaborative practice agreement. Develops and implements a collaborative practice agreement in the specific clinical area and performs a periodic review of the collaborative agreement.
* Completes diagnostic and therapeutic studies
* Completes charting in a thorough and timely manner
* Performs physical and medical screening examinations
* Works within legal, regulatory, and ethical practice standards
* Adequately manages patient flow in the Emergency Department
* Completes required courses, i.e. HIPAA, EMTALA and other CME /CEU requirements
* Orders diagnostic laboratory tests, radiological studies or other therapies as appropriate
* Actively participates in staff meetings and risk management education
* Instructs and counsels patients regarding mental and physical health, referring patients to appropriate specialists/resources
* Functions as House Provider (responds to all RRT 's and leads ACLS/Codes)
* Participates as a Member of the CWHMC CODE committee
* Establishes diagnostic decision-making and initiates a treatment plan, which may include ordering medications, and additional therapeutic modalities, etc.
* Performs procedures as allowed by state law and under the direction of the supervising or collaborating physician
* Coordinates patient care with other members of the health care team. Initiates consultation requests to other health professionals to provide comprehensive patient management.
* Provides acute/primary health care in accordance with written policies approved by nursing and medical administration.
* Performs a patient record review with the collaborating physician in a timely fashion but not less than every three months
* Other duties as assigned


**Job Requirements:**


* Physician Assistant Certification
* Registration & Licensure by the New Jersey State Board of Medical Examiners/ Physician Assistant Advisory required


OR


* Master’s degree in Nursing
* NP Certification
* Registered Professional Nurse with current NJ state license, CDS and DEA.
* Prior work experience as a professional nurse.
* 2 years of experience in Critical Care preferred
* Basic Life Support (BLS) and Advanced Life Support (ACLS) Certifications
* Active membership in a professional organization preferred
* Ability and willingness accommodate scheduling needs including working extended hours, weekdays, overnights, weekends, and holidays


**Knowledge and Skills:**


* Excellent time management skills
* Strong verbal and written communication skills
* Medical and broad-based clinical emergency medicine knowledge
* Ability to effectively and successfully work with all emergency department and hospital employees


Standard shift:


Day shift


Night shift


Work Location: One location


**Functional/Technical Skills Requirements**:


* Comprehensive understanding of operational health care delivery systems and the current health care landscape. Skills and experience with the operational aspects of health care technology deployment. Familiarity and comfort with technology-based operational improvement.
* Communications: Excellent written and verbal communications skills. Ability to take abstract, complex and/or technical information and break it down for a variety of audiences in a way that is meaningful for them


  

Location: CareWell Health · Physician  

Schedule: Per Diem, Variable, 7A-7P

title: Associate Account Executive, CNN Podcast Ad Sales
description:
***Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.***

**Who We Are…**

When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**Your New Role Accountabilities...**
-------------------------------------


CNN seeks an Associate Account Executive, Podcast Ad Sales, to join CNN Audio's Revenue and Partnerships team.

**Your Role Accountabilities...**
---------------------------------

* Manage your sales pipeline and generate leads.
* Identify and Build relationships with Podcast Advertisers – specifically brand direct clients.
* Handle inbound leads and sales opportunities.
* Work closely with internal Warner Brother Discovery (WBD) Sales leads to help prioritize audio opportunities and act as the CNN audio subject matter expert.
* Build a strong relationship with internal content partners to help better position our audio offering in the marketplace.
* Analyze campaigns success metrics for brand partners as well as internal stake holders

**Qualifications & Experience...**
----------------------------------

* Roughly 5 years in Podcast Account Management and/or Audio Ad Sales
* Strong passion for News, Sales, and Podcasts!
* A team player who wants to be part of a team of a dynamic audio leadership team
* A hunter mentality with a proven ability to generate new business.
* Strong ability to analyze and compute data
* Proficient with the sales cycle – and able to work independently.
* Desire to grow and have a career in audio ad sales

 **How We Get Things Done…**


This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.

**Championing Inclusion at WBD**


Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.
If you’re a qualified candidate and you require adjustments or accommodations to search for a job opening or apply for a position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.
In compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation, or a range thereof, for roles in locations where legally required. Actual salaries will vary based on several factors, including but not limited to external market data, internal equity, location, skill set, experience, and/or performance. Base pay is just one component of Warner Bros. Discovery’s total compensation package for employees. Pay Range: $94,500.00 - $175,500.00 salary per year. Other rewards may include annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards. In addition, Warner Bros. Discovery provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, an employee wellness program, life and disability insurance, a retirement savings plan, paid holidays and sick time and vacation.

Job Description**Who We Are…**


When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the *storytellers* bringing our characters to life, the *creators* bringing them to your living rooms and the *dreamers* creating what’s next…


From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.

**Your New Role…**


This position supports warehouse activities for flagship retail and North American e-commerce at Harry Potter NY. Our goal is to improve support to the store, improve the efficiency and timing of deliveries, and fulfill ecommerce orders in the local market. This role will focus on processing incoming purchase orders, putting stock away, picking stock to support store and ecommerce orders, and dispatching orders to our Flagship store.

**Your Accountabilities…**

* Accept, check, and receive incoming orders from suppliers into our warehouse. This includes ensuring records are accurate and correct.
* Put away orders into racking in a safe and efficient way.
* Accurately pick orders for stores and ecommerce operation.
* Prepare and dispatch replenishment orders.
* Report any discrepancies in stock levels to the Warehouse Management team and support and assist on all inventory counts.
* Adhere to all H&S policies and procedures to ensure a safe environment for all visitors and staff.

**Qualifications and Experience…**

* Well organized and focused.
* Able to prioritize workloads.
* Able to communicate with colleagues.
* Works as part of a team with a flexible approach.
* Maintain minimal shrinkage through the efficient handling of product and packaging.

**The Nice to Haves**

* Experience of working in a warehouse (or similar) operation.
* Use of plant machinery including (but not limited to) forklifts, high reach equipment, and pallet trucks (training on our specific machinery will be provided).
* Interest in film and television, and if possible, Warner Bros.’ Wizarding World franchise.

title: Assisted Living RN Supervisor
description:
Springpoint is certified as a Great Place to Work as well as earning the distinction of being recognized as a Certified Age Friendly Employer and is a well-respected senior living provider serving the Mid-Atlantic region for more than 100 years. It consists of Springpoint Senior Living and its nine full-service Life Plan Communities and 19 affordable housing communities. It also includes Springpoint at Home, providing home care services, and Springpoint Choice, a membership-based program offering security for members.
  
  

Stonebridge at Montgomery is seeking an experienced AL Coordinator (RN) to join our team!
  
Stonebridge at Montgomery is a Springpoint Senior Living Community located in Skillman, NJ. We are seeking a full-time AL Coordinator to join our team. At Springpoint, our AL Coordinator is responsible and accountable for the direct delivery of nursing services in accordance with the Assisted Living Program regulations and established standards.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

* Conduct an assessment/health assessment on new residents upon or prior to admission.
* Develop a resident general service/health services plan based on the resident’s assessed needs.
* Periodically monitor and evaluate each resident’s physical and mental status for significant changes as per the Assisted Living Program regulations. Conduct family meetings as needed regarding changes in level of care.
* Provide medications and treatments to residents as needed. Follow-up with pharmacy and consultant as needed.
* Review and ensure completion of monthly wellness checks on all residents.
* Notify physician, family and Director of Nursing about changes or concerns about resident’s condition.
* Respond to emergency situations when in the facility and be available 24 hours, 7 days a week.
* Train Certified Medication Aides as per guidelines, follow-up and continue with required med passes, in-service(s), delegations as needed.
* Schedule with clinic and/or outside providers follow-up visits/appointments, tests, and consults.
* Conduct staff education and in-services on an annual and as-needed basis.
* Complete all required documentation in an accurate and timely manner as required by the Assisted Living Program regulations.
* Ensure that all residents have annual physicals with MD certification for AL.


**Education and Experience:**  

* High School Diploma or equivalent required.
* Must possess a current NJ Registered Nurse license.
* BSN Degree preferred.
* At least 2 years’ supervisory experience required.
* Experience as an Assistant DON in Skilled Nursing a plus.


**Comprehensive Benefits Package Including:**  

* Medical/Dental/Vision/RX Plans
* 401(k) with Company Match
* PTO and Holidays
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Supplemental Life Insurance
* Employee Bonus Referral Program
* Employee Assistance Program
* Wellness Program
* Tuition Reimbursement


Springpoint is an equal opportunity employer. No individual shall be discriminated against based upon race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, creed, national origin, citizenship, political or union affiliation, disability, marital or familial status, Veteran status, or any other legally protected status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact Human Resources.
